page.title: 03CANALS PAST & PRESENT
page.content: England's first canal was the Bridgewater canal which was built in 1761.There was a problem of transporting coal from Worsley to the city of Manchester.The Bridgewater canal was so successful that the price of coal was halved.In the 60 years following this canal-mania resulted in many miles of new canals.The Preston to Lancaster link was finished too late for it to be of benefit to industry as a result the canal is used by pleasure craft during holidays and at weekends. Locks are used in the places when land is not level.Locks are water steps each one having a set of gates to let boats in and out.The lock gates are opened by a windlass on the winder.When the boat is in the lock the boat is driven in and the water is let up or down.With the water at the right height the boat is driven out.
